Posts.Content: i went to gym twice a day everyday for 5 years before my diagnosis. I started up again 6 weeks out of treatment. Because of mild depression related to getting cancer so young I stopped going for 2 years. I've started again. There are no issues. Personally I'd stay off of testosterone supplements and stuff I used to take like Creatine.
Posts.Signature: 40 years old - Diagnosed at 40 Robotic Surgery Mount Sinai with Dr. Samadi Jan, 2011 complete urinary control and good erections with and without meds Prostate was small, 34 grams. Final Gleason score 7 (3+4) Less than 5% of slides involved tumor Tumor measured 5 mm in greatest dimension and was located in the right lobe near the apex. Tumor was confined to prostate. The apical, basal, pseudocapsular and soft tissue resection margins were free of tumor. Seminal vesicles were free of tumor. Right pelvic node - benign fibroadiopse tissue. no lymph node is identified. Left pelvic node - one small lymph node, negative for tumor (0/1) AJCC stage: pT2 NO MX

Posts.Title: life after p cancer?

Posts.Content: I was told to wait until the drain incision healed up and the cath was out. I prefer showers so it wasn't an issue for me.
Posts.Title: Bathing

Posts.Content: Agree with everything Highlander said. I had no side effects short of dry orgasms after surgery but that's probably because of luck, my very young age (40), the nature of my cancer, and the skill of my surgeon. The good news is that I've seen many men recover from the SEs over the course of a year or two. It's an ongoing process and you have reason to be optimistic. If things don't work out perfectly there are always medical procedures. Good luck.
Posts.Title: Prostate operation 9 weeks ago

Posts.Content: My surgery went perfectly, I'd recommend RP for qualifying cases any day under the proper circumstances (experienced surgeon). I've also read nothing but good things about BT and rarely a negative review. My thinking is that as a 40 year old with what appeared to be organ confined disease surgery was my logical choice, but if I was in my 60s I would have given more serious thought to BT. There are many equally effective forms of treatment depending on your particular situation and preferences.
